author: {'steamid': '76561198027994597', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1735, 'last_played': 1626990792}
review:
TLDR:
Campaign takes about 20 hours to complete on medium difficulty. Game offers no replayability after completing.
The main and best feature is this very interesting and unique spell system. Worth buying this game just to have some fun with that.


Good things:
- Very unique spell system. You need to experience it and have fun with it. So satisfying when you find a new spell combination that works well.
- Constant difficulty throughout the game (I played medium difficulty - archmage). The difficulty was pretty much constant from start to end, the game never became too easy and boring.
- Interesting boss fights. You will die several times before figuring the fights.
- Good puzzles, offering mostly average or low challenge.
- Great variety of environments in different levels.
- No "local area" map. You need to remember layouts of levels.
- Campaign on archmage difficulty will take you about 20 hours to complete. Add 5-10 hours on top of that if you want to find all secrets.

Bad things:
- Camera angles and zooms are controlled by the game and are often very bad. This causes problems in combat especially against ranged enemies who can shoot at you from 2 screens away and you cannot react properly to incoming projectiles or target them. My solution was to run away and lure enemies to a place where camera is better.
- Spells behave very weird or don't work at all, especially on steep terrain, but fairly often on plain terrain as well.
- Many spell runes are only useful in few specific puzzles tailored for them. After solving the puzzle, you will not use them ever again, because they are useless in combat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105539833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1054, 'last_played': 1626972815}
review:
Un jeu vraiment fun que j'ai fini √† 100% en une quinzaine d'heures (en mode facile, certes). Il m'a √©voqu√© Zelda par certains c√¥t√©s d'ailleurs, vu que souvent les runes qu'on trouve dans un donjon seront utiles voire indispensables pour progresser.
 
Deux types de puzzles dans ce jeu, les plus faciles √©tant une sorte d'assemblage visant √† illuminer des pi√®ces en les reliant les unes aux autres. Le second type de puzzle consiste √† r√©ussir √† acc√©der √† un coffre en cr√©ant un sort qui peut enclencher plusieurs torches/plaques/cibles interactives en m√™me temps ou dans un laps de temps assez court, et ce n'est pas toujours facile de trouver une formule qui marche ! J'ai trouv√© ces √©nigmes ni trop dures ni trop compliqu√©es √† titre personnel (elles pourront peut-√™tre para√Ætre r√©p√©titives √† certains je suppose ?), j'ai bloqu√© juste une ou deux fois.

le syst√®me de construction des sorts est vraiment vraiment tr√®s fun √† manipuler, surtout quand on commence √† avoir plein de runes √† notre disposition. Une boule de feu toute seule, c'est nul. Trois boules de feu qui ciblent l'ennemi le plus proche et rebondissent partout, puis d√©clenchent une explosion, c'est d√©j√† plus amusant. Faire pleuvoir des rochers sur la t√™te de mes ennemis ? Oh joie. Fuir une situation tendue en laissant derri√®re moi un double qui se fera un plaisir d'exploser √† la figure de mes adversaires ? Nice ! Cr√©er un sortil√®ge ultime qui encha√Æne tous les √©l√©ments disponibles dans le jeu et... comment √ßa ma barre de mana est vide ? Non, vraiment, c'est vraiment le point fort du jeu, j'ai pass√© un super moment √† jouer avec. M√™me les effets qui ont l'air sans grand int√©r√™t √† premi√®re vue sont en fait bien utiles. Genre vous la voyez cette perle paum√©e totalement hors de votre port√©e l√† ? Pourquoi tenter de la rejoindre quand on peut totalement l'attirer √† soi ?

Le sc√©nario ne casse pas des briques, √ßa fait tr√®s "jeu pour les plus jeunes", avec quelques passages du genre "oh mon dieu tout le monde est mort ! Mais c'est pas grave, tu veux une pomme ?", mais c'√©tait distrayant donc je ne lui en tiens pas rigueur.

La musique est tr√®s agr√©able, les zones sont jolies, les donjons vari√©s sans trop √™tre compliqu√©s. De ce c√¥t√© l√† j'ai pas trop √† me plaindre. Les ennemis ne sont pas tr√®s vari√©s, √† l'exception des boss, mais leurs r√©sistances √©l√©mentales ajoutent au challenge. 

Quelques points n√©gatifs cependant : 
- Le jeu est fait pour √™tre jou√© √† la manette, mais si on veut renommer nos sorts, il faut le clavier :/
- La carte du pays nous indique si une zone est compl√©t√©e ou non, mais √† vous de trouver o√π est le dernier machin que vous avez loup√© XD 
- Pas de journal de qu√™tes, non pas qu'on en ait beaucoup, mais bon √ßa aurait √©t√© pratique d'avoir un pense-b√™te sous la main, surtout pour les gens qui ne suivent pas forc√©ment, alors qu'au bout de certaines qu√™tes se trouvent des runes ou des baguettes bien utiles.
- Plus de mana, il me faut PLUS DE MANA !
- Le donjon de fin √©tait un poil d√©cevant compar√© aux autres.
- Il faut aimer exp√©rimenter, les effets des sortil√®ges peuvent √™tre tr√®s diff√©rents de ce √† quoi on pouvait penser.
- On ne peut pas se d√©placer avec le bouclier, donc la principale solution pour √©viter de se prendre des baffes consistera g√©n√©ralement √† courir partout (heureusement, le dash c'est la vie).

Dans tous les cas, m√™me si ce n'est pas un jeu parfait, je me suis bien amus√©e √† y jouer et je le recommande chaudement si  vous voulez passer un petit moment √† assembler des sortil√®ges pour faire pleuvoir mort et destruction sur vos ennemis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001111547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 826, 'last_played': 1626489256}
review:
As someone who likes Legend of Zelda games and Path of Exile, I enjoyed Mind Over Matt-er, I mean Mages of Mystralia. I think ultimately my favourite parts were the spell-crafting system and bosses and other challenging combat encounters. You have a lot of freedom in how you tackle most fights once you've unlocked a good number of options. 

The majority of required puzzles weren't bad either, though I didn't like many of the optional puzzles. Many of them required lighting torches from a specific spot at a specific angle, or at least that's how I solved them; create a spell that makes sense then sling fireballs over and over and hope something lands. I played using a controller, and I can imagine it being much rougher on keyboard.

Adventuring was okay; you can do a moderate amount of exploring, but all the major dungeons have to be done in a linear order.. And I feel there was too little content left after unlocking most major spell options: you could then come up with plenty of cool spell ideas but then have very little left to fight.

It may sound like I'm largely pointing out negatives, but all in all I did find it enjoyable and with some really neat mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027106910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1625468581}
review:
It's pretty, the story telling is good, the gameplay is fun, and the presentation is excellent. I don't doubt that it's a great game. 

The only problem is that it's controls are designed to work with a joystick. It makes it difficult to control your character and in narrow sections forces you to zig-zag to avoid falling off the map. Fighting also becomes a real problem when the attack does not go in the direction of where you are clicking because it can't correctly identify where your mouse is. 

Honestly this game shouldn't have been released on the PC.

review:
Blocking is pointless
using fireball is pointless
Using ice is pointless
Using your stupid little electric wavy wand is the only thing that does any damage

The game forces you to do a boss, trapping you into an arena that you cannot leave, even if it's not feasibly possible for you to finish it
You're forced to watch a dumb cutscene every time you die to the boss
There is no dodge button
I saw nothing of the spell customisation, probably because the dev thought forcing people to do some stupid boss that they probably cannot complete is a good idea
The controls are clunky as fuck

There is no windows borderless option = Automatic shit game (Seriously, fucking add it, that's literally minimum requirement and by not adding it, you're a fucking moron)

author: {'steamid': '76561198005647931', 'num_games_owned': 1650, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1496883687}
review: A thoroughly mediocre experience. Its spell system has a lot of potential, but it never uses it in any very interesting ways. Despite pitching itself like it has some kind of masterful story, what you actually get is generic fantasy that you won't remember after two weeks. This isn't a terrible game and I could see some people having fun with it for the $5 sale price, but it's nothing like the revolutionary wizard game that the original Kickstarter pitch suggested we could expect.

The magic system is too good to not build upon.

author: {'steamid': '76561199013339251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1625183756}
review:
The art is cute and fresh, the puzzles can be a bit complicated in terms of timing, but even being very subpar at timed events I've been able to do them in a couple minutes so far. The fights are interesting, the monsters engaging, the lore exceeded my expectations for a puzzle adventure game by miles. And gosh, the spell customization is amazing I could spend all day creating spells to combo with eachother in chain reactions, love it to bits.

Would absolutely recommend giving it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068982092', 'num_games_owned': 909, 'num_reviews': 401, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1624931926}
review:
At first, I was excited about the game because of the spell crafting.

The long and mediocre exposition dialogues disappointed me a little.

But the fights really made me bored. Since there is no animation cancelling, you can't attack more that twice without running away or eating shit. There is no parry or evasion (at least in the basic spells) and the shield is so slow to pull up so it's better to just move away.

But I kept moving through tougher and tougher fights because I was really looking forward to the spell crafting. This all culminated on a okay boss fight. After the fight, I used my first very first rune to open up a mine in the boss area. I took a quick look but wasn't sure there was anything I could do there for now. So I walked out and went back through the boss area to leave. But, at the entrance, the boss respawned, the pre-fight cutscene played again and the door locked itself again.

So yeah, I gave up.
The game looks great, the puzzle seem good and I can definitely see the Rune system's potential but I was bored for most of my playtime. The gameplay, especially at the beginning of the game is really holding it back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097035260', 'num_games_owned': 2023, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 1197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1197, 'last_played': 1623538001}
review:
An adventure with an incredibly fun and flexible spell casting system, which is really the main draw here. Rarely does a game let you get this creative with combat, and the system allows players to become quite overpowered, should they choose to.

The story is basic, and there is quite a bit of backtracking as you gain new powers and abilities. Music is good and the puzzles range from easy to challenging, but the solution is always within reach. 100% is possible in 20 hours, but you could finish the story much sooner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150408564', 'num_games_owned': 65, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1034, 'last_played': 1622529714}
review: 8/10 - Really fun little game! There is about 7 hours of content without 100% it (I would say 12 hours including all the extra puzzles and side quests), and every single bit of it is really fun and cheerful. The art style is nice, especially for some of the larger and more mystical settings, though some of the characters look pretty ridiculous. The main mechanic is really fun to play around with, and while it is super easy to pick up and do most puzzles, it takes a bit of messing around with it to really get understand the full range it has, and some of the puzzles require that complete understanding (I used a guide eventually). Music is lovely throughout, the plot is pretty okay and works well for this game, and the world building is done really nicely in a way that implies lots of history without shoving it down your throat. Not too difficult once you get used to combat (I recommend using hit and run tactics for the 1st half of the game), and admittedly difficulty drops off massively when you get a certain trigger rune (however this makes you feel like an all powerful mage and so combat is never truly boring).

author: {'steamid': '76561199074746823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 272, 'playtime_forever': 863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 863, 'last_played': 1621264442}
review:
This games is a little gem. A good adventure with  balanced and cool magic spells-abilities to craft your own way and so on. At times battles are quite chaotic but in a good way. Good music, art it's quite ok too. Nice to play and with a well  cared lore. I did enjoyed it a lot. My good review is a must. 

Una peque√±a joya que pasa desapercibida. Mages of Mystralia es una aventura con buena musica, visualmente bonita (aunque no destacable), buena jugabilidad con magia-hechizos-habilidades equilibradas y que vas mejorando durante el juego y que puedes combinar como te d√© la gana. Tiene tambi√©n un "minijuego" de rompecabezas que es entretenido. Lo m√°s cuidado es su lore, la esencia del juego en la que se nota el mimo de los desarrolladores.  
Los puzles est√°n bien pensados y las peleas a veces son m√°s estrategia que hack and slash por doquier. Las batallas en ocasiones pueden ser ca√≥ticas, pero en el buen sentido, de estar concentrado y tal. La verdad es que me pill√© el juego como un pasatiempo casual y acab√≥ sorprendiendome gratamente. Lo he disfrutado bastante y por descontado es recomendaci√≥n segura. A jugar!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000445428', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1040, 'last_played': 1619697665}
review:
[i]An otherwise unremarkable action RPG with a standout magic system.[/i]

[h1]Setting and Worldbuilding - 7/10[/h1]
The worldbuilding behind Mystralia isn't bad. The world itself is a fairly bland European fantasy world with mages and mythical creatures. On the other hand the writers have put in an above-average effort considering this. You get glimpses of the history of the place, including different eras of rule and the place that mages had under each. Your spellbook companion is even a character from the past, who gives little insights as to how the world has changed since his time, and why. For example, the profitable crystal mines have closed, and the quarry has flooded, each with an explanation and an impact on the world's people. I appreciate this! It's no Skyrim with libraries full of lore, but considering the medium which is an action RPG, I think this is more than sufficient.  

[h1]Plot - 5/10[/h1]
Despite the interesting setting, the plot of [i]Mages[/i] is a bit of a letdown. Without spoiling anything, it basically boils down to a basic "hero's quest" where you have to assemble the items required to beat the bad guy. There are a few interesting twists that add some spice, but they're generally predictable. The whole story ends up feeling very shallow, and you don't even really have to think about it for 95% of the game.

[h1]Exploration and Collectibles- 8/10[/h1]
This is a sure strength of the game. There are so many interesting things to find, including treasure chests with gold, soul beads for upgrading your stats, new glyphs to spice up your spells, new wands to vary up your gameplay, and various other collectibles for use in quests. Because you unlock new glyphs along the way, you end up having to backtrack to apply your new abilities to things you've passed. This allows for a nice amount of stuff to do even after you beat the game! Points also go to the devs for putting in: a) a completion percentage for each area, making it easy to see where you need to go next without making it too easy; b) a hint system for the tricky puzzles; and c) puzzles that tell you when you don't have the required items to complete a puzzle so you shouldn't even bother. Lots of quality of life features here!

[h1]Magic System - 9/10[/h1]
The magic system is a fairly clever building-block system, where you start with one of the 4 "spells", choose an element for those spells (fire, ice etc), and then tweak its behaviour with glyphs, e.g. to make the fireball move, bounce between enemies, explode on hit, home in on enemies etc. This is by far the most interesting magic system I've encountered in any game so far, and it's very refreshing! The only downside of the system is that it occasionally gets a bit complex. It's not clear if the actual arrangements of glyphs in relation to each other matters, because in most cases it doesn't, but occasionally it does - for example the "move left" glyph certainly has different behaviours depending where it is, but others don't seem to do this.

[h1]Puzzles - 8/10[/h1]
Mystralia several diverse types of puzzle, some of which involve crafting the right kind of spell for the scenario, some of which involve classic Zelda-like dungeon thinking, and some of them are straightforward (but hard) light beam puzzles. The diversity and also integration into the magic system makes these a winner. 

[h1]Combat - 8/10[/h1]
All combat in Mystralia is done using magic, and not surprisingly since the magic system is so good, the combat is also! You have access to shield spells, dodge spells, close combat spells, ranged spells, area of effect damage and crowd control, all with different spell types and elements. You keep finding new ways to make combat spells, and new enemies keep being introduced with their own strengths and weaknesses, making this always fresh! My only complaint is perhaps that getting knocked over takes an obnoxiously long time to get up, and that I feel like once I crafted a certain set of spells, all combat became super easy ([spoiler]Creo + Stone + Rain + Mastery obliterates whole swathes of enemies, and Actus + Stone + Bounce + Mastery makes self-replicating boulders that continually damage and knock down small groups of foes[/spoiler]. Still, overall very good!

[h1]Graphics - 5/10[/h1]
It's not that the graphics are poor quality, just that the chosen art style is very unappealing. In particular, I just can't stand the character designs, who all look like caricature portraits. There is no human character whose design I like. However, the environments are very nice and bright, if a bit uninspired (generic European fantasy world strikes again!). The spell effects are nice and make spellcasting quite fun as well!

[h1]Music - 6[/h1]
I actually can't remember a lot about the music. I think I remember it being quite good? But not super memorable.

[Linux Support - 6/10]
Since this isn't natively released for Linux I can't give this a higher score, but it does run [i]very[/i] well on Linux using Proton/SteamPlay, so I'm very appreciative for that!

author: {'steamid': '76561198022971323', 'num_games_owned': 2600, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 807, 'last_played': 1619935568}
review:
[b]This game is Mage-tastic![/b]

I have always loved playing as mages in RPGs, be they video games or tabletop, and Mages of Mystralia is a perfect example of why. The essential journey of the mage is from struggling weakling to death-dealing demigod. And yes, any RPG has your character start weak and get more powerful, but fighters generally start slightly weak, and become slightly powerful, whereas a true mage starts as a fragile glass baby who dies from a few little melee hits, but also only has enough mana to cast a couple spells.

But then, the turn. Once your mage crosses that threshold of power, they become a force to be reckoned with, often able to dispatch whole legions of enemies from a distance before they can even approach.

Mages of Mystralia definitely has this, and they accomplish it with one of the best spell-building systems I've ever seen. Basically, your spells are all grid maps onto which you can graft a variety of different behaviors, so while your basic fire spell creates a flame next to you, move makes it a firebolt, detonate makes it a fireball, duplicate and rain makes it a rain of fire, etc. You can craft spells that veer right, left, or randomly. And, my personal favorite, you can even cast spells that cast other spells.

[b]Spells that cast other spells[/b] is the reason I found myself laughing maniacally 75% of the way through the game, having created a spell that casts a barrage of 5 ice balls and then casts itself, and also any of those ice balls that hit an enemy spawn 3 fireballs. It uses all my mana in one cast. But also, I killed an elite miniboss by pressing the Y button once, hence the maniacal laughter. I have named my spell: "[b]Preposter-ICE[/b]"

Aside from the raw power, [b]you also need to craft spells to solve puzzles[/b]. There are various puzzles in the game, some just connecting things on a grid, but some where you need to light torches in inconvenient locations within a time limit, which is all about crafting the perfect spell to do so. Maybe a barrage of 3 fireballs all veering left which bounce off of walls?

I realize I've talked a lot about spells because that's my favorite part. But really, the whole game is high on charm. Wonderful music, cute graphics, satisfying spell system, enjoyable puzzles... really the only downside to this game is that the first couple hours (before you have more than 1-2 spell runes) feel a little slow because you don't have enough options yet. But as soon as you've unlocked a handful of runes, the game just gets better and better until the end. The end comes pretty fast too; the game certainly doesn't overstay its welcome.

If you can get through having to deal with a lack of awesome spellcasting options for the first couple hours, this is a fun and charming game well worth the while for any appreciators of the arcane arts.

Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007798804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 894, 'last_played': 1619805605}
review:
TL/DR:
Summary :This is a great game. I appreciated the spell mechanics and mini puzzles. 
Its very simple to play, has an interesting story and is suitable for all ages. Its a fairly short game making the price tag a little harsh.(Just criticism, not meant as complaint-See below)



Long:
I tried this one because it was listed as similar to Magicka in an article I read. It doesn't have the open ended casting/combos that are in Magicka. But the spell mechanics are very different in a great way. Its more of a design/puzzle setup that is quiet amazing. The full range of spell creation/modification didn't click immediately. 
Once I realized the depth of possibilities with the mechanics/design I almost squeed. When I realized how short the game is I was a little bummed. The price seems a little high for a game you could probably beat in a few hours. Even with leaving the game on pause a bunch, spending long periods of just messing with the spell creation and exploring and testing my savage creations, I had pretty much beaten it all in <12 hours (This is just normal difficulty).
BUT... This is Borealys Games first produced product. They nailed it if you ask me. Its high quality work with awesome mechanics. 
I am very happy with my purchase and will be buying their games in the future. 
This game is a border line masterpiece. Thank you to the creators and all the backers. I thoroughly enjoyed every minute.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097303252', 'num_games_owned': 429, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 1130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1130, 'last_played': 1619700657}
review:
for the most part it wasn't a waste of my time, but its certainly a waste of a mechanics
this concept has so much potential, phenomenally so, its downright criminal!!!!!! i cant stand it!!!

the spellcrafting is never really fully taken advantage of, and easily turns into one button win
ultimately there's not much here to do with the spellcrafting, so few runes, and so little content/variety to enjoy/work with
you really need a more open ended environment than a linear storyline

total elemental immunity is just cheap, and the trial staff makes all other staves pointless
the combat was bland, particularly the javelin goblins constantly stunning you, rock falls are barely visable
alongside both defensive & evasive options being rather poor
the awkward left-right puzzles were tedious and clumsy at best

basically the game was over once i had impact, duplicate, bounce, rain and homing, all i did was trigger a self triggering homing 2 spell loop (impact + bounce + rain + homing + duplicate to a copy of the same spell, back to the first), from a ranged spell, sure i had to dodge around and evade while dumping all my mana, but as long as i avoided the enemies, the spell would simply delete everything, (random, size, mastery, gaea, etc just added further to the effectiveness)

in that regard some balancing is in order, but also a deep need for viable damage avoidance mechanics

you can easily imagine the potential, by adding a few small systems, for instance, opt in features like;
secondary wand, stored spell slots/loadout switching, split mana bar(between wand or loadout, etc), assignable hotkeys for instant slot switching or instant cast without switch, more overcharge mechanics, more rune logic (including follow near target, cast on cast, pre casting, empty element, alternate elements, more "anti" properties like "random", etc), unequipped spells(combo spells which don't waste quick slots), etc

also if you had a reason to collect orbs, kill enemies, rewards for revisiting areas, for loot for shop items, etc, unique upgrades/traits, custom wands, mob specific drops, etc, some incentive to actually kill the mobs you pass(not in a grindy way ofcourse)

in other areas, the music was only pretentious some of the time, mostly just filler noise that would otherwise drive me insane if i had to listen to it any further
yet again another game where every damn cutscene/dialogue/credit-screen is unskippable!!!! 
characters are ugly and boring particularly MC giant ass bigger than even monkey's ears
"voices" were jarring at best, no voices would actually be better than this joke
story was meh AF basically only read >%15 of the dialogue
a couple "side-quests" are just "look-online-quests"
no way i'm 100%ing this, I've wasted enough time slogging back and forth, seriously every area deserves its own portal pad, more than one loading screen is one too many just to get were you're going, your game isn't any more special than anyone elses, none are, I've already wasted far too much time slogging through every other slogfest game and their constant backtracking, i'm sick of padding even unintentional, respect your players time damn it!!

otherwise it was alright, definitely worth a look, good inspiration for other game devs, cos we all know this dev team aren't ever gonna expand on the spellcrafting, so someone else has to

TL;DR

its alright, cool spellcrafting system, much unmet potential, nothing much else

author: {'steamid': '76561198079708406', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 720, 'last_played': 1687562728}
review:
Absolutely amazing little game, really am surprised id never heard of it before, really scratches that magic itch that so many games cant. 
Brilliant spell mechanics and a lot of interesting combos you can do once you understand how everything works, and the puzzles help learn new ways to combine different aspects. on top of that the story is well written and explains the world wonderfully.

author: {'steamid': '76561198247436852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 681, 'last_played': 1615121611}
review:
I tried to give this game a fair chance, but it wasn't clicking with me in the end. 
If you like Zelda type games, this might work for you better than it did for me. 

Overall, the big hinders for me [i](and might be for someone reading this)[/i] were slow magic casting times [i](even though I had the wand that allows you to cast "fast")[/i] and lack of nuanced direction [i](knew what I need to progress, wasn't able to locate for the longest time)[/i]. 

The game itself is not hard and some boss fights are enjoyable. The challenge is in how lucky or willing you are to spend time figuring out where to find things you need to progress.

I don't particularly recommend this game, but I know that there are people that might thoroughly enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970704077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1617382833}
review:
Played on Linux using Proton, runs incredible smooth and without any issues.

Finished the game with 100% achievements in 13 hours.

Cute story, characters, music and magic-mechanics. It's quite "Zelda-like" with an interesting mechanic for progression (not new weapons/items, but spell components).

It's relatively easy and short, but nonetheless very enjoyable and all fun. Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972739270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1617419683}
review:
So, when do I get to play the fun parts?

Maybe it comes into its own after a few hours, other reviews around the 20hr mark make it sound like it does. But these days I value my time more than that. Get to the good stuff in under 30min, [i]then[/i] make me sit through your story. Put the filler in the middle.

I know I've only got 90mins on, but i've covered half the (first?) in-world map, done about a dozen quests, and have precious few options to make spells (four augments). The game insists on doing cutscenes for every action, wastes your time with a boilerplate story that is too generic to care about (the dialogue could really use cutting down), and doesn't deliver on the promise of crafting creative spells.

The mechanics themselves are both too precise and too sloppy to be particularly fun. Every spell you cast is controlled both by your cursor location and your movement direction. This somehow always ends up being the exact opposite of what you want. Dashing doesn't respect your movement direction, it's your cursor direction (which might be fine in a click-to-move blink-build, you like you might find in POE, but this still uses WASD). Attacks look like they're going to go towards your cursor, but if you're holding the opposite movement direction, it sometimes ends the cast animation and shoots it in the wrong direction. Dashing is strangely slow and has no iframes and doesn't bypass collisions, etc. I'm sure there's a logic there, that if you learn the quirks it becomes less cumbersome; but i'm not interested in sitting around to do that when it doesn't give me anything interesting to do.

I'm also really not sure why mana is a mechanic, either. It regens in a few seconds after no casting, and the only outcome is that it makes you stop and run in a circle after you got your tempo going. Might not be so bad if enemies were squishier and you didn't need to stay in tempo so long, but right now it just emphasizes the tedium.

I want to like it. This is an idea I've wanted to see more fleshed out for almost a decade now, this system holds promise. But maybe i should have known what it was about when the first screen says "best played with a controller".

author: {'steamid': '76561197964959255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 985, 'last_played': 1615343648}
review:
100%'d this game, it's worth it even though it's lacking in the length department.

If playing a Zelda-like game while crafting your own spells (nearly limitless combinations) sounds interesting to you, then try it out. It's great! Story is nothing you haven't seen before but the gameplay is where it's at.

I suggest setting the difficulty to maximum.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148214188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1615257883}
review:
I really don't know how they could mess this up.
Conceptually, this game seems great; I love the prospect of creating your own spells and making spells to solve puzzles.  But holy hell, this game takes almost every opportunity to be inconvenient.  Combat is a clusterfuck, with almost every encounter featuring enemies that throw projectiles - projectiles that stun, projectiles that freeze, projectiles that home infinitely.  Many enemies have some kind of survivability quirk - some require a finishing blow, some split and regenerate, some burrow and become invulnerable.  But the absolute worst thing about combat is how completely inept your protagonist is.  Zia is slow in absolutely everything she does, it makes it damn near impossible to get ahead in combat; moving, shielding, and especially mana regeneration are all painfully slow.  Take a protagonist who can scarcely dodge or block attacks, make her very fragile, let her do so little damage, and make her mana regenerate at a snails pace, and pit her against hordes of enemies that spam projectiles, have annoying gimicks, and move almost faster than you do, and you're in for a very bad time.  To append to that, in addition to being all around weak, your spells are all jank.  Your "melee" spell is close range with the option to either explode, or the ability to charge it, but not both; the charge is seemingly useless as I can't imagine ever pulling it off, but even the explosion is useless beyond puzzles, as it's often a terrible idea to approach enemies due to previously mentioned reasons.  Your ranged spell can do things like home in on enemies (targets the wrong enemies, or circles around them), or fire multiple shots (enemies seemingly have i-frames, because multiple shots don't seem to do much more damage), or trigger your "melee" on hit (adds minor damage and effects at the cost of draining your mana even faster, resulting in more exciting waiting).  Your "creating" spell is almost completely utilitarian with sparing use in combat.  And then your fourth spell is where they decided to cram every other ability, including shielding, dashing, and creating copies, to name the first few, resulting in your constantly having to swap spells.  Constantly check which of your four plus spells is equiped, lest you use the wrong one in combat and get stun locked to death.

In addition to all previously mentioned points, bosses are especially obnoxious.  First, you can enter them with less than full health, as only collectable hearts refill your HP.  Not even checkpoints heal you, despite healing completely when you die and respawn there.  Second, there is absolutely no skipping in this game, neither cutscenes nor text.  If you inspect something twice you just have to sit there and mash.  And if you die to a boss, what with their high health, high damage, and annoying gimicks, you get to watch drawn out cutscenes every death.  Third, in rare instances like the first boss, certain triggers and flags are poorly designed, where things like important collectables are saved, but progress like defeating a boss are not.  At the first boss you can defeat the boss, collect the spell, and then die before touching another checkpoint as neither of these things count as one.  When you respawn you will have the spell, but reentering the area will trigger the boss, cutscene and all; plus, when you beat the boss, the original entrance doesn't reopen, as you can't interact with the chest that was already spawned after the first instance.  This is fortunately resolved by entering the adjacent area, but it is still impressive that this exists.

A few more gripes.  Money is plentiful, as every destructible drops it, and as there is nothing to spend it on.  Some rare instances, but the biggest money sinks are items that revive and items that restore mana.  Yes, their alternative to waiting around for your mana to slowly recover mid-combat is consumable items which you need to travel all the way back to the hub-like area to purchase; you can only ever have five max, and you will run out of mana several times per encounter.  The control scheme.  The game recommends a controller, which I agree with for general gameplay, but several parts of the game, namely spell creation and rune puzzles which are built on a hex-based grid, are not very controller friendly.  This is my most opinionated complaint, but if I am in just about any form of menu, anywhere "2D," I vastly prefer using the D-pad.  There is implementation for the D-pad, you can use it in these contexts, it's just damn near impossible to actually use.  There is actually a rune puzzle that is impossible to solve using solely the D-pad, as it cannot navigate to a specific location.

I could go on, but this review is already just me ranting to no real resolution.  The game has potential, but it sorely lacks polish.  I realize that making games is hard, and that that's probably insulting to the developers, but the game feels far too crude in all the aspects that are important to me.  The game could be worse, but buyer beware.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134402186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1614957855}
review:
Je recommande Mages of Mystralia pour tous les joueurs appr√©ciant un jeu RPG aventure simple mais remplis de bonnes surprises et poss√©dant un gameplay tr√®s rafra√Æchissant pour le genre, une bande son agr√©able, une histoire simple mais assez touchante et prenante ainsi des √©nigmes surprenantes et satisfaisantes. Je d√©veloppe dans la suite.
J'ai re√ßu ce jeu dans un Bundle donc pas vraiment gratuitement mais presque mais je peu quand m√™me dire que c'est une petite perle. Deux facettes du gameplay brillent selon moi par leur originalit√©. La possibilit√© de concevoir ses propre sorts √† l'aide de diff√©rentes runes et √©l√©ments est vraiment surprenante, on s'y prend vite √† vouloir cr√©er des sorts ultra puissants qui partent dans tous les sens et c'est jouissif de voir leurs effets d√©vastateur sur les ennemis (bien que le co√ªt en mana force le joueur √† cr√©er des sorts ing√©nieux mais pas abusifs pour vraiment jouer s√©rieusement). La deuxi√®me est la n√©cessit√© de cr√©er des sorts sp√©cifiques pour chaque √©nigmes. En effet souvent les √©nigmes propos√©s demanderont au joueur un sort sp√©cifique ou une encha√Ænement pr√©cis pour les r√©aliser ce qui cr√©er une agr√©able satisfaction quand nous arrivons par nous m√™me √† trouver la bonne combinaison de runes  (car oui le jeu propose des aides en √©change de perles d'√¢mes pour les impatients) autant pour la cr√©ation de sorts que pour les petits puzzle propos√©s pour ouvrir certaines portes. Qui plus est la direction artistique est agr√©able bien qu'assez simpliste mais les musiques, elles, sont particuli√®rement bien travaill√©s et collent parfaitement √† l'univers en plus de favoriser l'immersion dans ce monde plein de magie et d'√™tres issues de l'univers fantaisie. L'histoire est quand √† elle assez bien ficel√©e bien qu'un peu bateau et sans grandes surprises elle reste agr√©able √† parcourir  et maintiens le joueur en haleine.
Bref un jeu simple mais surprenant que je recommande autant aux fan du genre RPG action r√©flexion pour le gameplay rafra√Æchissant, qu'aux personnes qui d√©couvrent le genre ou le jeu vid√©o tout court.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136046683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1614207200}
review:
Pretty fun Zelda-esque game.

The art style is nice and the spellcrafting part of the game leads to some pretty cool spells that you can make. However, the combat can be frustrating at times, with spongy enemies that chase you down while you have to stop in place to cast most spells.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986889613', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1097, 'last_played': 1614030827}
review:
Fireball with auto-aim. Check
Fireball which spawns fire behind it. Check
Fireball which explodes into water blast on contact which freezes enemies. Check
Fireball which bounces off enemies into more enemies. Check
3 Fireballs at once! Check
5 Fireballs at once! Check
Fireball of every single element (electric, fire, water, wind) at once. Check
Sliding on ice. Check.
Slide on ice while you spawn copy of yourself as distraction which fires fireballs with all abilities of above. Check.

Revolutionary magic system with "indie" graphics and relaxing music. Puzzles, lore, zelda like map exploration and combat with "stamina" bar. Don't miss on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967052056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1129, 'last_played': 1613249094}
review:
This was quite a fun little adventure game with a very imaginative and fun spell system. While there are some tedious puzzles, the majority of them were really enjoyable, bite-sized, experiences.

It feels really clunky at the very start, but once you get the 'Move' rune is when the game really gets going, steadily giving you an ever increasing repertoire of abilities to customize your spells with. Eventually you can make some truly ridiculously powerful spells to rampage around with, like a turret that just sprays everything with homing magic by itself.

I thoroughly enjoyed my time with this game, and look forward to play something similar in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017068257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1634580791}
review:
ACTION RPG + PUZZLES
Gr√°ficos         8  (Cartoon geniales)
Historia          6  (Sencilla pero no aburrida)
Linealidad      4  (Es bastante lineal)
Dificultad        6 (Es f√°cil pero te mete en problemas de vez en cuando, perfecto para desconectar)
Desarrollo PJ  9  (Muy original combinaci√≥n de hechizos)
NOTA FINAL 6.6

Me ha sorprendido gratamente, es muy entretenido, es f√°cil sin llegar a ser aburrido, algo lineal, y con unos gr√°ficos que enamoran de estilo c√≥mic-cartoon. Pero sin duda lo mejor de todo son las combinaciones que se pueden hacer para crear tus hechizos y lo bien que est√° implementado esa variedad a la hora de resolver puzzles.
Tienes varios tipos de hechizos, varias cualidades diferentes, modificadores de las cualidades y potenciadores, as√≠ como diferentes elementos que tienen efectos diversos, todo ello combinable a tu gusto lo cual resulta en una infinidad de posibilidades a la hora de dise√±ar tus hechizos, sencillamente genial.
Por ejemplo si en un hechizo de crear bola de fuego le pones la cualidad de movimiento y el modificador de b√∫squeda, tendr√°s una bola de fuego que se lanza a distancia y que busca al enemigo, si todos esos modificadores se los pones a un hechizo de escudo en vez de a la bola de fuego, tendr√°s un desplazamiento de tu personaje mientras atrae objetos. Un efecto totalmente diferente con los mismos elementos tan solo cambiando el conjuro base. Si usas un disparador que lance otro hechizo puedes hacer una lanzamiento de bolas de fuego en cadena, lanzar una bola de fuego cada vez que crees una plataforma helada o justamente lo contrario, en fin, como digo infinitas posibilidades.
Muy muy recomendable

Si quer√©is echarle un vistazo aqu√≠ lo probamos en directo:
https://youtu.be/ucDObCMU_gA

author: {'steamid': '76561198320204924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1548, 'last_played': 1667412302}
review:
Bellissimo  gioco, completamente soddisfatto e vale ogni centesimo.
Trama non banale, narrazione incalzante, sotto trame anche abbastanza profonde e atmosfera completamente riuscita. A questo aggiungiamoci il game play basato sugli incantesimi "componibili" che ti fa sentire ancora pi√π immerso nel mondo di gioco.

Unica "pecca", il gioco consiglia di giocare con un controller, se potete fatelo perch√© io giocando con mouse e tastiera spesso finisco gi√π per i dirupi (comunque si pu√≤ benissimo giocare anche con mouse e tastiera, io sto per finirlo ad esempio).

author: {'steamid': '76561198048385679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 786, 'last_played': 1610195835}
review:
DA EVITARE ASSOLUTAMENTE!

Il gioco √® pensato per far impazzire il videogiocatore, letteralmente.
Le hitbox dei boss e dei mob √® imbarazzante: anche quando i colpi vengono palesemente schivati, si riceve comunque il danno. 
I combattimenti sono TROPPO sbilanciati rispetto alla velocit√† della meccanica di gioco: spesso si affrontano orde di mob con resistenze ai vari elementi in quantit√† eccessivamente superiore (il rapporto √® di 1:20 in condizioni normali) che, sommato al problema delle hitbox, rovinano gravemente e inesorabilmente l'esperienza di gioco. 
Per sconfiggere il boss finale √® necessario risolvere dei puzzle in troppo poco tempo, questo si traduce spesso in frustrazione per il videogiocatore perch√© oggettivamente non √® possibile risolvere quel tipo di puzzle in cos√¨ poco tempo (a meno che non si conosca la soluzione a memoria).
A fine game restano troppi oggetti da sbloccare: modiche alle magie e bastoni inaccessibili fintanto che non si hanno determinate magie, che comunque non vengono date nemmeno alla fine del gioco nonostante si facciano le quest secondarie o i puzzle game. 
Tutto questo elenco √® stato riscontrato a difficolt√† NORMALE, cosa che rende i punti sopra elencati ancora pi√π assurdi.
Infine, nel mio caso, c'√® un bug che impedisce la corretta chiusura del gioco e sono costretto a ricorrere al task manager di windows: quando si cerca di chiudere il gioco avviene una stasi della schermata (loop).

L'unico aspetto positivo del gioco √® la meccanica delle magie, che √® oggettivamente affascinante e intrigante......peccato che l'esperienza di gioco venga distrutta e rovinata dai gravi difetti elencati.

EVITATE QUESTO GIOCO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122509872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1609709614}
review:
Une grosse d√©ception.

La musique est douce et tellement r√©p√©titive qu'√† la fin elle est plus √©nervant qu'autre chose tout comme l'h√©ro√Øne qui est une v√©ritable cruche incapable de nager, incapable de sauter...


La personnalisation des sorts qui ce qui a fait que j'ai pris ce jeu est anecdotique.
Au final, tu te retrouve √† utiliser tout le temps les m√™mes sorts en combat parce que certaines am√©liorations sont inutiles. 
Et en dehors des combats? Tu joues comme les devs l'ont pr√©vus parce que pour les √©nigmes, tu n'as pas le choix: tu dois jouer des am√©liorations sp√©cifiques pour que ta boule de feu tourne en rond ou bouge dans une direction pr√©cise.

Un v√©ritable faux-sentiment de libert√© qui m'√©nerve et qui fait que ce jeu au cadre enchanteur me tape sur les nerfs en plus des m√©lodies...

author: {'steamid': '76561198046375373', 'num_games_owned': 931, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 816, 'last_played': 1609555505}
review:
The artstyle and "voice acting" seem quite obviously inspired by Magicka, in case you like it. The story is serviceable, good mages vs bad mages in a fantasy setting, moving on. The spellcrafting system is pretty interesting and unique, allowing some fun combinations of effects; if you like to tinker with that kind of system you should feel pretty satisfied by the endgame. 

For reference, I called one of my favourite combinations the "Puzzle Solver", because when you use it, only a couple of puzzle rooms in the game manage to not get solved in less than a second. I see this as a positive and a testament to the freedom this system allows by the endgame.

Another one I used a lot is just a continuous loop of offensive spells that created a multi-elemental nuke every time I cast it. You can loop spells into each other for big combos and even bigger damage, but that can potentially deplete your mana and leave you defenceless for a few seconds. High risk, high reward.

The slight tedium and difficulty the first enemies give you when you start the game and you're super weak only serve to enhance the absolute hubris you'll experience by the time you stomp the final boss. I'd recommend the game just for that.

You can 100% the game in about 13 hours. I used a guide to find a couple of unmarked quests, but it's more than doable without it with a bit of patience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995168241', 'num_games_owned': 492, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5983, 'last_played': 1658092789}
review: I love the spellcrafting system in this. And the throughline of the constellation puzzles really make you feel like you are learning the ways of magic and uncovering new spells all the time. Great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198012374319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 401, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1609432274}
review: Nice game without pretention.  The spell creation system ends up getting ponderous but it's still nice to tinker with it a little bit. Puzzles and combat are engaging without getting frustrating (except in the Dark Tower).

author: {'steamid': '76561197994240185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1609394032}
review: I completed all the achievements in about 12 hours, so it's pretty short. I had a lot of fun though. It's cute, you get to make spells, goblins explode. It's a good time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198831064899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1609376035}
review: Okay this game was an absolute gem. It was everything I wanted and more. The story was nothing astronomical but I found myself invested nonetheless. The magic system tho, blew me away, it is so good. I've been wanting a magic system like this for a long while and to see it done in such a smooth fashion felt amazing. Bonus the graphics are adorable.

review: Very original game, the aspect of making spells that can overpower enemies in one swing of your wand is amazing. 8/10 game, don't think it's finished yet though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067570803', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1609219859}
review: Overall I would give this game a respectable 8/10. The whole thing took me 11 hours from start to finish on hard. I think I accidentally found an OP spell combination that basically put all my mana into one shot and I started one-hitting some of the bosses lol. I enjoyed the spell craft system and the story was reasonably enjoyable. I felt exactly 0 need to grind (which is a plus in my opinion). It did take a little bit to get rolling in the game, but overall I definitely think it's worth a play. I would say the ideal audience would be older children or younger teens, but the novel spellcrafting with the simple difficulty curve makes it a game worth running through.

review:
An action adventure puzzler with a charming story and graphical style, Mages of Mystralia reminds me of The Legend of the Zelda series, complete with breakable pots full of goodies, highly recommended.
I got this game on sale through a Humble Bundle, but it's worth the full price.

review: Superbe jeu, beaucoup de flexibilit√© dans la cr√©ation des sorts c'est vraiment amusant comme m√©canique. Quand on commence √† cr√©er ambitieusement, le jeu devient rapidement trop facile. J'esp√®re quand m√™me une suite avec encore plus de possibilit√©s ! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198009815581', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1622939312}
review:
In my opinion this game is worth every penny.
I got it super cheap on a discount but i feel bad for paying so little for so much content,
Story line is really interesting and funny, characters has very unique personalities and music is lit.
Combat system is extremely fun and rewarding and it really makes you think and be creative when you are mixing new spells.
There are a lot of hidden easter eggs, treasures and collectables scattered across the world.
This little gem really need more spotlight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139755292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1103, 'last_played': 1605850603}
review:
good clean innocent fun, the spell crafting system is fun and allows for a lot of customization (as well as some truly wacky spells), the combat is fun and satisfying, and the puzzle solving was a fun change of pace  (and this is coming from someone who doesn't usually enjoy puzzles), i was hoping for more RPG elements and a journal to track treasure and quests was something i often wished i had while playing.

all in all... i'm looking forward to the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300580651', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1010, 'last_played': 1605316231}
review:
[h1][b]La sed de poder es algo [strike]in[/strike]evitable[/b][/h1]

[h1]Historia [/h1]
Dicese de una era de magos donde en una ocasi√≥n un mago se volvi√≥ loco por la sed de poder y comenz√≥ a destruir todo, luego se decreta una regi√≥n libre de magos. Pero ocurre que a una joven le despierta su magia de la nada e incendia el lugar donde viv√≠a, ocasionando su expulsi√≥n de la villa donde viv√≠a. Sin lugar a donde ir se encuentra con otros magos y a lo largo del camino va aprendiendo la historia de todos los magos y el porque ocurri√≥ la "tragedia".

[h1] Jugabilidad [/h1]
El juego es corto, bastante lineal y con una jugabilidad bastante b√°sica. Le√≠a en varias ocasiones que la forma de jugar cambia un poco si se usa control en vez del mouse/teclado. Pero realmente no encontr√© mucha diferencia.

[h1]La magia es complicada[/h1]
Uno de los aspectos que m√°s me gust√≥ y que me frust√≥ bastante fueron los puzzles. A lo largo del juego te encontrar√°s con peque√±os rompecabezas que te har√°n pensar bastante y m√°s por que la forma de resolverlos es encontrando la forma correcta de utilizar la magia. As√≠ es, el juego te provee de unas runas que cambian la forma en como el hechizo funciona y eso hace que se generen hechizos bastantes √∫nicos como algunos un poco m√°s complicados, realmente la posibilidad de tener var√≠as formas de combinar estas runas me pareci√≥ interesante, pero tambi√©n bastante complicado porque al tener m√°s runas, consumen m√°s puntos de magia haciendo casi que imposible la concatenaci√≥n de esta.

[h1] Calificaci√≥n personal[/h1]
Historia: 6/10
M√∫sica: 7/10
Gr√°ficos: 7/10
Jugabilidad: 8/10

Promedio personal: 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198045185194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1605377258}
review:
Great litte action RPG with lots of puzzle mechanics and exploration. Combat is fun. Sometimes a little wonky, but mostly solid. Story is also pretty good. Set within a beautiful world with interesting characters.
I would like to play a sequel! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198055820024', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1605997930}
review: Mages of Mystralia is incredibly fun and brings a novelty factor to the genre. Combining effects to a spell makes things way more interesting and boss battles can be quite challenging. If you are a fan of games like Legend of Zelda, I would recommend you to give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071985830', 'num_games_owned': 727, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1605229992}
review: Not a bad game, just not a good one. Dropped it for one reason: unbalanced difficulty, which comes down to  spamming you with enemies, very sparse checkpoints and issues with spellcasting in general. All of that wouldn't be so bad if there was actually anything else to keep you playing. It's all rather bland and the combat is unsatisfying, the only standout feature is a rather simple but interesting system of customizing spells.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104263374', 'num_games_owned': 413, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1605018384}
review: 40 minutes in and I would not recommend this game. Story is very rushed and not flushed out. You drown if you go in water but immediately leaving the starting area you're sucked into a cutscene where your character has to swim. You find a spooky looking book in the middle of the woods and your character's first thought is "better take this with me" for absolutely no reason. You start the game burning down your house, your mentor tells you to burn any monsters you meet in the woods, and the first spell you learn is an electric spell? Not even the second spell, it's your third spell when you finally learn freaking fire magic. Upon making it to your first location goal you're immediately told to just go out and do a mission, having literally 0 prior knowledge of the arcane arts. Despite magic being forbidden you immediately meet 3 people who seem to have no issue with you holding a wand and spell book or casting spells.

author: {'steamid': '76561198324725958', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 681, 'last_played': 1606003644}
review:
Mages of Mystralia est un bon jeu RPG qui permets aux joueurs de cr√©er ses "propres sorts". En effet, jusqu'au point que j'√©tais rendu de l'histoire, il y avait d√©j√† beaucoup de possibilit√© de cr√©ation, mais je n'ai point encore assez avancer l'histoire ou d'exploration pour trouver le reste qui me manque pour mes cr√©ations. Cependant, je tiens √† dire que le sentiment de libert√© pour la cr√©ation de sorts n'y est pas au d√©but du jeu. Car on a tr√®s peu voir que "4 possibilit√© de sorts". L'histoire est pas digne du d'un chef d'oeuvre, mais joue bien son r√¥le. S√©rieusement, m√™me si je l'ai eu gratuitement, 22$ CAD semble un bon prix.

P.S.: Je viens d'avoir un bug de sauvegarde. Le jeu lance la partie √† l'endroit o√π j'√©tais, mais a reset ma progression: sort, runes, argents, etc. Ce n'√©tait arriv√© les autre fois mais l√† √ßa un bug qui fait chi√©.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076535403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1613, 'last_played': 1604900538}
review: Enjoyable puzzle/ action game.  The mechanics were pretty good.  The end game had a steep learning curve and was more about the right spell than skill which I did not like (IE played same section for three hours until I changed spell and then beat section in like ten minutes.) This was also the first time I had to change spell usage mid-battle. Not done the rest of the game... I also wish there was a more in depth mini map that game way more information.  End of the day though, it was not perfect, but I liked it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017268704', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1954, 'last_played': 1603475211}
review:
Un jeu unique qui vaut vraiment le d√©tour. L'histoire est int√©ressante, le design proche de la BD original... mais ce qui fait le point fort de Mage of Mystralia ce sont ses m√©caniques de jeu ! En collectant petit √† petit les runes, on r√©alise que les possibilit√©s de combinaisons de sort quasi infinies. Et quoi de plus jouissif que de les tester sur le terrain face aux ennemis :D
Je salue √©galement l'intelligence des concepteurs qui proposent un syst√®me d'√©nigmes sous forme de puzzle dont les m√©canique sont similaires √† celles de la cr√©ation de sort...une fa√ßon d'apprendre √† associer ses sorts tout en progressant dans le jeu. Vivement la suite !

author: {'steamid': '76561198006862645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 804, 'last_played': 1605574122}
review:
Pros: 
- Pretty, hand-painted graphics
- Creative and fun spell customisation
- Many, varied puzzles, in all shapes and sizes

Cons:
- IMPORTANT: Some (optional) puzzles appear to be unsolvable using a gamepad/controller
- The spell system can take time to fully understand, despite the tutorial
- The story sometimes falls a little flat


This is for the most part a very fun and charming game, and although it is quite short I honestly didn't mind that very much. It felt like an appropriate length for what it was trying to do, which in my mind is preferable to stretching out a game experience for the sake of it.

I may not have found the story very interesting, but that's not the game's strong point and it honestly feels like it knows that. This is a puzzle game first and foremost, and the puzzles are top notch. There are so many of them, and there's all kinds. Moving platforms, environmental hazards and obstacles (often themed to showcase the different places you travel to), mazes, logical puzzles, lateral thinking; you name it. At higher difficulties even the combat becomes a sort of puzzle to be solved: where to stand, when to run, who to take down first, and of course which spells to use and how.

Experimenting with creating spells is a lot of fun once you get the hang of it, but it took me some time before the full complexity of the system became apparent. Some emphasis and a more intuitive tutorial could have been added to show how dramatically a spell can be changed depending on the order in which you place the different customisation runes. For although it is definitely no trouble finishing the game without delving into the system, I felt like that's where a lot of the fun lay.

One important thing should be said about the use of a gamepad/controller versus keyboard and mouse: some of the optional (but well rewarding) puzzles in the game appear to be unsolvable with a gamepad, due to how different the aiming of spells work. With a gamepad you can choose only the direction to cast in, although there is a limited kind of auto aiming. With a mouse, however, you can click where you want the spell to go, and thereby adjust both angle and distance. This seems a glaring mistake considering the game recommends use of a gamepad, and it's especially a shame since it's otherwise well suited for being played with a controller.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970594435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 958, 'last_played': 1602506412}
review:
A great fun combination of action and puzzles somewhat akin to the Zelda games

The rune system that allows the creation and modification of custom spells is very enjoyable and help freshen up the slightly repetitive combat. Graphics are simple but pleasant, the music is relaxing and the overall plot somewhat cliched but still enjoyable.

At around 10-15 hours it felt just right in terms of length, and was enjoyable throughout.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965787122', 'num_games_owned': 672, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 853, 'last_played': 1602437654}
review:
If you are in doubt of playing this game, don't skip this one. 
It is a very charming and fun game. At first glance it may look simplistic but it sure is not. The graphics are smartly done for an indie developer. The gameplay has more depth than you would think; as a basis you have 4 type of spells. There are many runes that change the behavior of spells, and there are many spell combinations with weird and awesome results. You will quickly find a spell that will fit your play style. These spells are used in puzzles too, which will make you see other possible spell modifications. 
The story is nice but don't except a mind bender. Controls are fine with the only remark that the menus are sometimes a bit cumbersome, but that could also be my own incompetence. And on a final note, I personally enjoyed the musical score very very much. It is orchestrated amazingly and the musical flow between gameplay situations is so well done, and will be remembered by me for a long time :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197993475161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 841, 'last_played': 1602392722}
review:
You could compare this game to Magicka.... but I feel like 80% of the fun in Magicka is preparing for the moment when one of your spells will inevitably backfire and manage to electricute, vaporize or drown all your friends. 
Mystralia does none of that since it's single player. Instead it just has a really awesome solid magic crafting system with a lot of room for creativity and experimentation. 
As you collect ruins your arsenal of mayhem only increases and the only way to collect ruins is to use existing ruins to solve puzzles. The puzzles are pretty great and it immerses you in the feeling that you're getting more powerful as you do smart things like a mage should ;D

The overworld is well crafted with lots of secrets to find that utilize your abilities. I can only say good things about this game. The graphics and story are charming, the music is great, the particle effects on the spells glitter as they repeatedly burn and freeze in place all the goblins on and off screen. 

This was great. I hope they make a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035305667', 'num_games_owned': 481, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 649, 'last_played': 1602986186}
review:
An interesting Zelda-like Action RPG with a creative battle system but marred by cheap difficulty, no way to deal with multiple enemies effectively (as the game loves throwing mobs at you), little time for recovery mid-battle, and general other glitches.

This isn't a strong dislike in any way, I'd give it a 6 out of 10, maybe 7, but it's below what I usually find average for a game and wish it was better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041990871', 'num_games_owned': 882, 'num_reviews': 254, 'playtime_forever': 889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 889, 'last_played': 1600314381}
review: Overall pretty fun game. Not very long, but it works for this kind of game. The spell creation system is really good.  Not a perfect game by any means, but I never really felt like the game was bad in any way, except the part where it recommends using a controller, but it wouldn't recognize any of my controllers. Other than that the game was really fun to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040884369', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1129, 'last_played': 1600356286}
review:
I made a spell that shoots three rocks that bounce around and home in on enemies.
When one of those rocks hits, it recasts itself.
It recasts itself basically until my mana is depleted, usually resulting in hundreds of homing rocks that bounce around the battlefield killing anything that they can see.

You might be wondering "well what if the enemy is immune to earth magic?"
I wondered this too. So I equipped a special wand that makes my earth spells ignore resistance.

I am now the rock mage.
And nothing can stop me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049240385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1598302421}
review:
How can someone let such type of game be released with such SHITTY, slowpoke and UNprecise control in 2020? Being forced to play with a controller on PC isn't enough already, it has to be that bad?
Really, with all the extra money they got from the kickstarter, I am disappointed... I was really looking forward to it, the magic system appealed me so much, I found the graphics cutely cheesy... then I tried to play... never even got to try the system and already don't want to continue that game... sad... at least I didn't pay full price...
I rarely post opinion on game, but here I feel the need... Sad having to make it so negative, I had hoped to send a better one

author: {'steamid': '76561197989723238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 719, 'last_played': 1597506512}
review: Great puzzles lovely customisation of spells although the playthrough takes less than 11 hours all told. And that is with being a completionist

author: {'steamid': '76561198044751083', 'num_games_owned': 1379, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 804, 'last_played': 1597450411}
review:
A lovely game that makes you use your head, while also encouraging you to try some new things. Plenty to explore and find to improve and change your arsenal. While not too deep a game, story-wise, the plot is interesting and fresh in a way that made me want to keep going. 

Wound up beating the game and still only being at 70% completion, so there was even more to see than I wound up seeing even after playing for so long. Each knew locale made me wonder what new spell I would be able to craft, while each new turn had me longing for more to test my skill.

The game can be a solid challenge. Running head first was a death sentence, and I played on the easiest mode. Maybe I will go back for the higher difficulty later and gather all the spells, but for now, I'm quite satisfied with the game I have played.

Ultimately, I'd have say this game reminded me of both zelda and metroid, but only in the feel and slow upgrade fashion. The magic system was unique compared to other games I've played, and the lore was fascinating, if a bit old fashioned. I'd recommend playing through the first part of the game, at least. If you haven't burned down a forest, then you haven't gotten far enough.

review: Oh my goddddd.  This game is so sloooowwww.  It is so linear and repetitive and.....boring.  I played for an hour for my stream and I had to force myself to finish that hour.  I usually love games like this.  None of the puzzles were challenging.  I felt like I never had to think.  Even bosses feel predictable.  There's nothing unique feeling about this game.  It's exactly what you would expect it to be.  Won't be playing this again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014822757', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1595436861}
review:
Y E S

I can't say for how long I've been looking for a game with a decent spell-crafting system and I'm happy to announce that I found it! 

Mages of Mystralia hits the perfect spot, providing great number of options while creating spells, while being easy to understand and use. By far the best part of the game is just to create abusrd spells which might as well classify as nuclear weapons huh.

That being said game has several issues - some of the puzzles are jank af, even if you have everything needed to complete them it might take you unnecessarily long time to do so. Enemy variety is pretty poor with high use of reskinned goblins with different elemental powers. Pacing is on the slower side, you only start getting "Fun" runes closer to the middle of the game, before that your options are quite limited. Speaking about runes, games expects you to do a lot of backtracking if you want to get them all, which I'm not a huge fan of. I would have preferred to collect the missing stuff in NG+ (alongside nuking the shit out of early game bosses), but it is sadly absent from the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122677317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 611, 'last_played': 1596054535}
review:
Una mezcla de Magika y Zelda. El juego comienza suave y se va complicando. La libertad xa crear hechizos es un sistema genial. Al principio parece un poco lineal, xo tras un 30% del juego completado, las posibilidades a la hora de crear hechizos son muy variadas. Estoy muy enganchado y se lo recomendaria a cualquiera q le guste la magia... 
El sistema de creaci√≥n de hechizos es una simplificaci√≥n del Ars Magica (el juego de rol) y durante el juego hay muchos gi√±os y referencias a los grandes de los mundos de fantasia como Terry Pratchet. 
No os dejeis enga√±ar por su apariencia "infantil". Avanzar y resolver puzzles en el juego requiere de habilidad e ingenio. Un precioso desaf√≠o...

author: {'steamid': '76561198039398429', 'num_games_owned': 962, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1689226758}
review:
Honestly the game has beautiful design, but the story is kind of... Lackluster? It's not uninteresting, but the development of the story is pretty plain.

That being said, I have not seen a single more interesting and fun to use magic system. You build spells using core spells, then runes and enhancements to change the effects that the spell has. You can make a fireball turn in a tight loop left, or make a fireball that bounces off walls and explodes when it reaches a target.

I highly recommend playing this just for the fun of using the magic system. While you do have to find runes to actually mess with the spells- it is worth every minute of time spent using them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198339364734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1589660644}

author: {'steamid': '76561198068957272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1595019504}
review:
I want to like this game, but it's honestly really frustrating at times. Pre-boss cutscenes are unskippable. The checkpoints are infrequent. When you die in a teleport challenge, you go back to the checkpoint instead of just appearing near the teleporter. All of this is heavily exacerbated by the clunky combat.
Even in the spell creation, which is what the game is supposed to be for, has its limits. Although it is robust, you can't put all behavior mods on all of the essences. I was looking forward to making my own spells and becoming OP by my own machinations, but nope, can't do that now.
I would not recommend this game to any friends of mine.
The last straw was when there wasn't a checkpoint right before the slime boss. Consider it uninstalled.
